verse: Across his empire, on the land and along the coasts, King Ahasuerus imposed taxation upon the people.
All of King Ahasuerusâ€™ accomplishments, as well as the great work of Mordecai, whom the king promoted, are written down in the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia.
For Mordecai the Jew became second-in-command to King Ahasuerus, and he was highly revered among the Jews because he worked for the prosperity of his people and was an advocate for their well-being.
